intro: Gilia klickitatensis, commonly known as the Klickitat gilia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. The plant is often found in moist to dry soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
